intro: Calyptronoma occidentalis, commonly known as the western calyptron, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, characterized by its small, clustered leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant has a compact growth habit and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its botanical features include woody stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that help reduce water loss. Calyptronoma occidentalis is of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its unique adaptations and ornamental value.
